sentences.en: A volley of bullets ripped into the facing wall.
sentences.cn: 一排子弹射进对面的墙上。

sentences.en: Always walk facing the oncoming traffic.
sentences.cn: 走路一定要面向驶来的车辆。

sentences.en: He's now facing suspension after a dust-up with the referee.
sentences.cn: 在与裁判发生争执后他现在面临着停赛。

sentences.en: It is one of the most pressing problems facing this country.
sentences.cn: 这是该国面临的最紧迫的问题之一。

sentences.en: St Bartholomew's is one of four London hospitals facing the axe.
sentences.cn: 圣巴塞洛缪医院是伦敦4个面临关闭的医院之一。

sentences.en: Students all over the country are facing an uncertain future.
sentences.cn: 全国各地学生前途未卜。

sentences.en: The country is facing a crisis unparalleled since the Second World War.
sentences.cn: 该国正面临着一场二战以来前所未有的危机。

sentences.en: There are no easy answers to the problems facing the economy.
sentences.cn: 解决经济所面临的问题并非易事。

sentences.en: There's been a lot in the papers about the problems facing stepchildren.
sentences.cn: 报纸上有很多关于继子女所面临的问题的报道。

sentences.en: Thousands of bank employees are facing redundancy as their employers cut costs.
sentences.cn: 雇主削减成本的时候，数千名银行雇员面临被解雇的命运。

sentences.en: Thousands of factory workers are facing redundancy.
sentences.cn: 数千名工厂工人面临裁汰。

sentences.en: Traders in Marble Arch are facing huge rent increases.
sentences.cn: 大理石拱门的经销商们面临租金的大幅上涨。

sentences.en: Universities are facing grave problems because of diminishing resources.
sentences.cn: 由于资源的减少，大学正面临严峻的问题。

sentences.en: Up to 300 workers are facing the axe at a struggling Merseyside firm.
sentences.cn: 艰苦挣扎的默西赛德公司有多达300名工人面临被解雇。

words.tran_cn: 有某种面孔或表情的；有…表面的
匿名的，不知名的；无个性的；无脸面的
脸；表面；面子；面容；外观；威信
意外打击；（拳击中）面部所受的突然一击；铣刀盘

phrases.tran_cn: 熔接硬面法，加焊硬面法；表面硬化（淬火）

trans.tran_cn: 饰面，覆盖（如墙壁的）表面的覆饰，（衣服的）贴边
trans.tran_en: an outer surface of a wall or building made of a different material from the rest in order to make it look attractive

trans.tran_cn: 面对( face的现在分词 )，面向…，正视，承认
